captures.author: @pankajkumar_dev
captures.text: Claude Sonnet 5: The "Fennec" Leaks - Fennec Codename: Leaked internal codename for Claude Sonnet 5, reportedly one full generation ahead of Gemini's "Snow Bunny." - Imminent Release: A Vertex AI error log lists claude-sonnet-5@20260203, pointing to a February 3, 2026 release
captures.whyInteresting: Breaking news about Claude Sonnet 5 release tomorrow (Feb 3) with codename Fennec

captures.author: @hasantoxr
captures.text: BREAKING: Someone just solved Claude Code's biggest problem. It's called Claude-Mem and it gives Claude persistent memory across sessions. - You can use up to 95% fewer tokens each time. - Make 20 times more tool calls before reaching limits. 100% Opensource.
captures.whyInteresting: Claude-Mem provides persistent memory for Claude Code - massive efficiency gains (95% fewer tokens, 20x more tool calls)

captures.author: @IntCyberDigest
captures.text: An ex-Anthropic engineer just published a 1-click remote code execution exploit for OpenClaw (formerly Moltbot and ClawdBot). The attack occurs in milliseconds after the victim visits a webpage, giving the attacker access to Moltbot and the system it's running on.
captures.whyInteresting: CRITICAL SECURITY: RCE vulnerability in OpenClaw/Moltbot/ClawdBot - directly relevant to our setup

captures.author: @nbaschez
captures.text: Single biggest improvement to your CLAUDE.md / AGENTS.md: "When I report a bug, don't start by trying to fix it. Instead, start by writing a test that reproduces the bug. Then, have subagents try to fix the bug and prove it with a passing test."
captures.whyInteresting: Direct actionable advice for our AGENTS.md - test-first debugging approach

captures.author: @JustJake
captures.text: If you haven't done this already It's going to get very, VERY painful very VERY soon [Quote: Rumor is FAANG style co's are refactoring their monorepos to scale in preparation for infinite agent code]
captures.whyInteresting: FAANG companies preparing codebases for agent-scale automation - industry trend signal

captures.author: @simplifyinAI
captures.text: Vector databases just got disrupted. You can now build RAG without Vector DBs. PageIndex is a new open-source library that uses document trees instead of embeddings. It achieves 98.7% on FinanceBench by letting LLMs reason over structure rather than matching keywords.
captures.whyInteresting: PageIndex: alternative to vector DBs for RAG with better accuracy (98.7% FinanceBench)

captures.author: @ayushtweetshere
captures.text: This is the most impactful way I've seen someone use @openclaw. Bhanu should turn it into a product... [Links to Mission Control guide - 10 AI agents working together]
captures.whyInteresting: Complete guide to building AI agent squad (Mission Control) - multi-agent architecture

captures.author: @thekitze
captures.text: nerfed all of my @openclaw agents and will equip them with skills and tools from scratch. your accountant doesn't need access to your home assistant. your customer support agent doesn't need access to your nas etc
captures.whyInteresting: Best practice: principle of least privilege for AI agents - relevant to our agent setup

captures.author: @andyreed
captures.text: how it feels to navigate an enterprise saas codebase with claude [Video]
captures.whyInteresting: Viral video about Claude + enterprise codebases - cultural moment

captures.author: @rryssf_
captures.text: While everyone is sharing their OpenClaw bots Claude Agent SDK just changed everything for building production agents. I spent 12 hours testing it. Here's the architecture that actually works (no fluff)
captures.whyInteresting: Claude Agent SDK production architecture - practical implementation guide

captures.author: @GOROman
captures.text: Moshi + Mosh + tmux + Tailscale is super convenient [Links to 'Claude Code in Your Pocket' article]
captures.whyInteresting: Mobile Claude Code setup guide - Tailscale + Moshi for remote access

captures.author: @frankdegods
captures.text: this is a huge deal, well done @x finally [Quote: The X API is becoming more affordable so we can finally stop with the janky automations]
captures.whyInteresting: X API pricing becoming more affordable - relevant for Twitter automation

captures.author: @chatgpt21
captures.text: Anthropic officially confirming that they are now in takeoff. Never stop accel posting..
captures.whyInteresting: Anthropic 'takeoff' confirmation - ties to Sonnet 5 release timing

captures.author: @steipete
captures.text: nah the ralph thing is the silliest thing of the year [Context: doesn't let Claude Code on his codebase, uses Codex, says Opus too buggy]
captures.whyInteresting: steipete (bird CLI author) prefers Codex over Claude Code due to bugs - interesting perspective

captures.author: @agentskills_ai
captures.text: Here's a very simple Openclaw use case that anyone can useâ€¦ I used to save the best links and posts I find throughout my day in a WhatsApp message to myself. Then look at them when chilling out on the couch at night. But Iggy (my Claudebot / Moltbot / Openclaw) name now...
captures.whyInteresting: Simple but practical Openclaw use case - link saving workflow
